titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Celestine De Martini Brooklyn Navy Yard collection ARC.029
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:19:31 +0000.

did.unittitle: Celestine De Martini Brooklyn Navy Yard collection
did.abstract: The collection contains 3 items: a Recognition of Service certificate awarded to Celestine De Martini, acknowledging his service as a civilian employee of the U.S. Navy during World War II; a photograph of Lieutenant Vance A. Tribbett, officer in charge of the Materials Inspection Department at the Brooklyn Navy Yard; and a photograph of employees of the Navy Yard Materials Inspection Department, including Angelo Iovine, Charles Rosario, and Jack Barnes. The latter photograph was taken outside the Navy Street Housing Project.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Celestine De Martini was a resident of Brooklyn, and worked as a civilian employee of the United States Navy at the Brooklyn Navy Yard (officially known as the New York Naval Shipyard) during the Second World War.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains 3 items: a Recognition of Service certificate awarded to Celestine De Martini, acknowledging his service as a civilian employee of the U.S. Navy during World War II; a photograph of Lieutenant Vance A. Tribbett, officer in charge of the Materials Inspection Department at the Brooklyn Navy Yard; and a photograph of employees of the Navy Yard Materials Inspection Department, including Angelo Iovine, Charles Rosario, and Jack Barnes. The latter photograph was taken outside the Navy Street Housing Project.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Celestine De Martini Brooklyn Navy Yard collection, ARC.029, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Brooklyn Historical Society also holds the Celestine De Martini photographs of the Ryder Club Grand March and the Italian American Civic Union Banquet, V1990.037. Please consult library staff for more information.
